channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLscienceAndDiscovery
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLscienceAndDiscovery, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The shocking reason Arctic rivers are turning rusty orange
item.description: Researchers found that ice can trigger stronger chemical reactions than liquid water, dissolving iron minerals in extreme cold. Freeze-thaw cycles amp...

item.title: Sneezing from cats or dust? Safe UV light may neutralize allergens in minutes
item.description: Sneezing from cats, dust mites, or mold may one day be preventable with a flip of a switch. Researchers at CU Boulder found that UV222 light can alter...

item.title: Childhood plastic exposure could be fueling obesity, infertility, and asthma
item.description: A sweeping review from NYU Langone Health reveals that everyday exposure to plastics—especially during childhood—poses lasting risks for heart disease...

item.title: Scientists finally capture water’s hidden state that’s both solid and liquid
item.description: Water, though familiar, still hides astonishing secrets. When squeezed into nanosized channels, it can enter a bizarre “premelting state” that is both...

item.title: A hormone that silences the immune system may unlock new cancer treatments
item.description: Scientists have discovered that cancer uses a hidden hormone to switch off the body’s natural defenses, allowing tumors to grow unchecked. By uncoveri...
